description.text:
At 1st level, a blightseeker gains the blights from the list below. When he prepares bombs at the start of the day, a blightseeker chooses which blight to apply to each bomb. If a blight has no duration listed, it lasts a number of rounds equal to the blightseeker's Intelligence modifier. At 1st level, a blightseeker gains the following blights.
Impairing: The target's base land speed decreases by 10 feet, to a minimum of 10 feet. This effect doesn't stack with itself. Minor Sickening: The target is sickened, but it takes only a â€“1 penalty on affected rolls.
At 6th level, a blightseeker adds the following blights to the list of those that can be applied to his bombs.
Fatiguing: The target is fatigued. Fear-Inducing: The target is shaken. Sickening: The target is sickened.
At 12th level, a blightseeker adds the following blights to the list of those blights that can be applied to his bombs.
Confusing: The target is confused. Exhausting: The target is exhausted. Nauseating: The target is nauseated for 1 round. Staggering: The target becomes staggered for 1 round.
At 18th level, a blightseeker adds the following blights to the list of those that can be selected.
Blinding: The target is blinded. Deafening: The target is deafened. Stunning: The target is stunned for 1 round.
